body.p: To his excellency Thomas E Bramlette

Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky- your petitioner. William Runyons says that at the Last ^May^ Term of the Boyd Circuit Court he was fined twenty dollars for retailing Liquor he says that said judgment was taken without hearing the evidence. he says the offence was charged to have been committed the 1st day of Jany 1861 He says that he is now fifty five years old- and never in his life had a Law suit- and never sold one drop of Liquor contrary to the Laws of the country- he says upon the accasion charged he had a little spirits in his House not for sale- he let a man have for his wife who was sick- he says for that he never charged or received one cent he askes a remission of the said fine so unjustly imposed
Sworn to before me by Wm Runyon this 4th day of June 1864-
Richard Scott J P B C
We the undersign petitioner say that Wm Runyons is worthy of credit on oath- he is poor with but one Eye a labouring man- and believe that the fine refered to in his petition should be remitted

J W Riely
C. L. McConnell
Geo. N. Brown
Wm Compton
B Burk
Wm Edy
Richard Scott

Boyd Circuit Court

Remit
12th July/64

I Inglebert Hartsock- state that I was present at the time the liquor was obtained for which the inditement was made against Wm Runyon - and state that the Liquor was got as states by Mr David Morgan for his wife when he stated was sick- and said Runyon refused to have the pay and no money was paid then- the Luquor was taken off without being drank
sworn to before me by Inglebert Hartsock this 6th June 1864
Richard Scott J. P. B. C

Post office- Catlettsburg Boyd County
